授業目的:
This seminar provides a practical introduction to processes of social scientific research applied in contexts for international business and management research. The emphasis is on the practical steps and decisions that students need to take and justify in order to produce a comprehensive and convincing research proposal.

The seminar offers training in the discourse (spoken & written) of international research. It gives students practice in preparation for presenting their research proposal orally to a critical and international audience of potential research supervisors.

Specifically, the seminar is designed to improve students’ skills and confidence relevant to identifying defining a research topic or ‘problem’, conducting a critical literature review, formulating research questions and objectives, formulating and implementing a research strategy and plan, selecting and justifying research methods, analysing, interpreting and presenting research data, drawing conclusions and making recommendations for future management practice and research.
到達目標:
By participating actively and collaboratively in this Group Research course, students should individually be able to:

- Demonstrate a practical understanding of the knowledge and competencies they need and can develop towards becoming recognised as a professional and ethical researcher in the fields of international business and management.

- Gain sufficient knowledge, skills and competencies to manage an independent research project effectively.

第1回: Research as a process of managed critical enquiry
第2回: Identifying a research problem: attention to audience
Prepare a critique of an example of 'seminal' research
第4回: Justifying choices of research method: critical literature review
Prepare a short, annotated (individual) Literature Review
第6回: Introduction to data analysis #1: testing research hypotheses
Draft a short questionnaire / survey instrument
第7回: Triangulation and controlling for bias: case study method
第8回:
Introduction to data analysis #2: multivariable analysis
Mixed methods approaches: case study simulation
Critiquing a published presentation of key findings (qualitative and quantitative)
第11回:
Instructor gives group feedback on draft research proposals

Exploring the social roles of researchers: professional, competent and ethical project manager
第12回: Assessing research(er) performance: validity, reliability and credibility (ethics)
Prepare a short individual research presentation that is based on the submitted and commented on draft research proposal
第14回:
Research Presentations (assessed)
Instructor gives feedback on research presentations
Students prepare and submit a final research proposal (assessed)

評価.成績評価Grading2:
備考　Note
Draft proposal (20%)
Drawing on the concepts and techniques present and discussed during the taught elements of the course, students should complete and submit a draft proposal for an individual research project. The instructor will offer individual and group feedback on these draft submissions.

Individual presentation (30%)
Students individually improve their draft proposal ready for an in-class presentation to the group. The peer group and instructor together offer constructive feedback that should enable individual students to prepare a suitable and (in research terms) convincing final research proposal.
